description.value: The charming scoundrel isn’t flat-footed to flanking, hidden, or undetected creatures of 4th-level or lower, or creatures of 4th-level or lower using surprise attack.
The charming scoundrel Strides twice. If they end their movement within melee reach of an enemy, they can Feint.

When the monster @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} a creature that has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals [[/r 2d6 #precision]] precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It’s small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.
description.label: Description

description.value: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.
description.label: Description

description.value: A sap has a soft wrapping around a dense core, typically a leather sheath around a lead rod. Its head is wider than its grip to disperse the force of a blow, as the weapon’s purpose is to knock out its victim rather than to draw blood.
description.label: Description

description.value: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.
description.label: Description
